results.title: Hats in the Ring
results.brief_description: Focuses on the role of women in local government and contains a collection of interviews with women involved in local government, including two Lord Mayors, Sallyanne Atkinson of Brisbane and Lecki Ord of Melbourne, Janice Crozio, former NSW Minister for Local Government, Dawn Fraser, NSW Member of Parliament, and Senator Margaret Reynolds, Minister of Local Government and Minister Assisting the Prime Minister on the Status of Women. Its aim is to encourage women to stand for.
results.description: Focuses on the role of women in local government and contains a collection of interviews with women involved in local government, including two Lord Mayors, Sallyanne Atkinson of Brisbane and Lecki Ord of Melbourne, Janice Crozio, former NSW Minister for Local Government, Dawn Fraser, NSW Member of Parliament, and Senator Margaret Reynolds, Minister of Local Government and Minister Assisting the Prime Minister on the Status of Women. Its aim is to encourage women to stand for.

Its aim is to encourage women to stand for.

results.title: Rube Goldberg Newsreel
results.brief_description: Rube Goldberg drew animated cartoons for newsreels distributed by the Pathe Company. This rare footage features him working on the animations.

constellations_other.name: 9.5mm Pathe-Baby and parents behaving badly
constellations_other.description: A look at the link between the Pathé-Baby system and animation, as well as the relationship between cinematic parents and their children.

results.description: Rube Goldberg drew animated cartoons for newsreels distributed by the Pathe Company. This rare footage features him working on the animations.

results.title: [Orsola: Teramo, 1960]
results.brief_description:
In the course of a day, Orsola writes her fiancé, Ulderico Ciabarra, a letter, goes out to post it and reads a magazine in the sunshine. The filmmaker, Francesco Di Silvano, was a family acquaintance and cinema enthusiast who proposed the film as a gift Orsola could send her fiancé, recently settled in Melbourne, Australia. The children that appear in the final sequence are related to the filmmaker.

Note: An excerpt from ‘Orsola: Teramo, 1960’ appears in ‘Innamorati’ (2001/3); a four minute digital storytelling work created by Roberta Ciabarra, ACMI Film Programer and daughter of Orsola and Ulderico, as part of a pilot workshop conducted at ACMI in 2001.For technical reasons a re-record of the narration was done in 2003.

Donor has requested that any de-accessioning of the 8mm film that it be returned to him or the family. File Note with Governance.
results.description:
A ‘day in the life’ of a young woman whose fiancé has emigrated to Melbourne, Australia. In the course of a day, Orsola writes her fiancé, Ulderico, a letter, goes out to post it and reads a magazine in the sunshine.

The filmmaker, Francesco Di Silvano, was a family acquaintance and cinema enthusiast who proposed the film as a gift Orsola could send her fiancé, recently settled in Melbourne, Australia.

The related work “Innamorati” - made by Orsola’s daughter - tells the moving story of Orsola’s marriage and her journey to Australia to be reunited with her husband.
description_for_label:
In the course of a day, Orsola writes her fiancé, Ulderico Ciabarra, a letter, goes out to post it and reads a magazine in the sunshine. The filmmaker, Francesco Di Silvano, was a family acquaintance and cinema enthusiast who proposed the film as a gift Orsola could send her fiancé, recently settled in Melbourne, Australia. The children that appear in the final sequence are related to the filmmaker.

Note: An excerpt from ‘Orsola: Teramo, 1960’ appears in ‘Innamorati’ (2001/3); a four minute digital storytelling work created by Roberta Ciabarra, ACMI Film Programer and daughter of Orsola and Ulderico, as part of a pilot workshop conducted at ACMI in 2001.For technical reasons a re-record of the narration was done in 2003.

Donor has requested that any de-accessioning of the 8mm film that it be returned to him or the family. File Note with Governance.

results.title: Winners [Series]
results.brief_description: ‘Winners’ and ‘More Winners’ are anthology series of fourteen telemovies, featuring historical drama, comedy, science fiction, fantasy, adventure and social realism. Each film celebrates individuality and the facing of difficult situations with courage and ingenuity.

results.title: Winners: The Paper Boy
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, ITC Entertainment, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, New South Wales Film Corporation, Jane Ballantyne, Bob Ellis and Paul Cox
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
During the Depression, Joe’s father gets the sack. The only money the family has is what 13 year old Joe earns from selling papers. Then Joe has a fight with his father and leaves home. He lives on the streets battling with his wits and his fists as he gets to know the characters of the city - the down and outs, the Communist agitators, the Sallies, and Old Harry.

Cast includes Christopher Schlusser, Tony Llewellyn-Jones and Linden Wilkinson.

results.title: Winners: The Other Facts of Life
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, ITC Entertainment, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, New South Wales Film Corporation, Sandra Levy, Julia Overton, Esben Storm and Morris Gleitzman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Ben can’t understand how people can live so happily with the injustice and disaster going on in the world. His family’s lack of response leads Ben to mount a one person awareness crusade. Nothing seems to distract Ben from the larger troubles of the world until a crisis causes him to focus his energies on loving and helping his family.

Cast includes Dennis Miller, Anne Grigg, and Ken Talbot.

results.title: Winners: On Loan
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, ITC Entertainment, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, New South Wales Film Corporation, Jane Scott, Geoffrey Bennett and Anne Brooksbank
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
At her 14th birthday party Lindy wishes she knew her actual birth date. But only her real parents would know, and they’re both dead. Or so Lindy and her Australian family think until a letter from her natural father arrives. Now she must decide between two families and two futures, between Australia and Vietnam.

Cast includes Marillac Johnston, John Walton and Belinda Giblin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Children’s Television Foundation, ITC Entertainment, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, New South Wales Film Corporation, Jane Scott, Geoffrey Bennett and Anne Brooksbank

results.title: Winners : Top Kid (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Gary is a ten year old whizz kid from a lower class family who becomes a famous radio quiz kid and star. He is accepted by his classmates at last. Problems occur when the quiz show starts to rig the answers. Gary is left with a difficult decision between honesty and fame. Part of the “Winners” series.
results.description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
